result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael O Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "D" Felony], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.
Paid in full from bond on file.
Obtain and maintain employment acceptable to his agent.  Not to voluntarily terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
If agent requires, complete a psychological evaluation and comply with all treatment and counseling recommendations.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Defendant to submit DNA sample, if not already done.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael O Nelson

records.addlTxt: 1.  Affidavit of John Matousek

Assistant Attorney General, Annie Jay appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Petersen.  Defense called Attorney J. M., sworn.  Defense attorney for the defendant at trial.  Exhibit 1 marked by defense.  Attorney M.'s affidavit.  Defense moved for admission of exhibit 1.  No objection.  Admitted by the court.  State cross examined the witness.  Defense redirect.  State re-cross.  Attorney M. released.  Defense called K.L., sworn.  Alternative PSI writer.  Defense questioned the witness regarding what she would have testified to at the original sentencing hearing.  Witness elaborated.  Compass assessment report discussed and her opinion given.  State cross examined the witness.  Witness reviewed the DOC PSI in response to a question regarding adjudications.  Defense redirect.  She found 3 criminal convictions.  No further questions of this witness.  No further evidence to be presented.  Defense made final argument in support of the motion.  State made argument against the motion.  Court denied the motion for postconviction relief.  Defense will draft the order.
Time for circuit court to decide the postconviction motion is extended to 10/18/19.

records.addlTxt:
Assistant Attorney General Annie Jay appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Matousek.  Parties have the PSIs.  No corrections noted by either party.  Victim C.P. made a statement to the court.  State recommended:  15 years initial confinment.  10 years extended supervision.  520 days sentence credit.  Defendant's mother D.N made a statement to the court.  K.L. made a statement.  She wrote the alternative PSI.  State objects to her making a statement.  She is adding to the PSI report. Continue.  State objects again.  Court asked her to keep it short.  State again objected.  Defense recommended:  Follow alternative PSI recommendation.   520 days sentence credit.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Parties stipulated to restitution.  Can be taken out of the bond.  

Court ordered:  10 years initial confinment. 10 years extended supervision.  520 days sentence credit.  Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.  Extended supervision conditions:  AODA and recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Psychological evaluation and comply with recommendations.  Obtain and maintain employment. In an occupation acceptable to his agent    Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.  $7672.63 restitution.  CC.
Kathy Laatsch resume (alternative PSI)
Send to Judge Goodman this date.  JMM
Routed to Judge Goodman

C.J.P-O.P.
(routed to Judge Goodman)
Sent to Judge this date.  JMM
Amended to include sentencing date.  JMM
Sentencing hearing May 29, 2018 at 3:00 p.m.

Assistant Attorney General Annie Jay appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Matousek.  Victim notification complied with.  Court read the charge and possible penalties contained in the amended information.  He understood.  Defendant plead no contest.  Citizenship and felony warnings given.  He understood.  There will be a restitution request.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire and his constitution rights with the defendant.  PSI will be requested.  No threats or promises made to the defendant to enter his plea.  Court reviewed the elements of the charge with the defendant.  He understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently.    Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide contrary to 940.06(1).  Sentencing hearing to scheduled.  PSI due 5/18/18.
State's Second Amended Witness List
Subpoena served on Capt. G.P. to appear at jury trial
Subpoena served on A.R. to appear at jury trial

Defendant appears in person with counsel John Matousek. Special Prosecutor, Asst. AG, Annie Jay appears for the State.  Defense objects to all the motions filed by the State; not being timely filed and gives his argument to support.  Requests a different date to hear the motions.  Defense also addresses the deadline for response and there hasn't been any discussion.  The offer is extended until Friday.  State makes argument regarding her motions.   Judge looks up statute cited by defense regarding time limits for filing of motions.  Court cites from the statutes that the Court can shorten the filing time.  Defense makes more argument.  Court affirms the state is moving to amend and add a penalty enhancer.  State confirms.  Will adjourn for an hour for Attorney Matousek to research motions.

Back on record at 2:35.  Attorney Matousek states what he researched regarding Schopper (sp?) vs Gehring.  Attorney Matousek still objects.  The Court asks the defense a third time if he objects.  He still objects.  The Court again states the State is only asking to amend the information with a penalty enhancer.  The Court grants that motion.  

Motion in Limine:  Impeachment - Attorney Matousek makes his argument regarding OAR's.  Court states he never allows OAR's as impeachment.  Disorderly conduct conviction, defense gives argument.  State make her argument to support.  Court states he will address that later.  #2 - defense will not illicite any information.  Also doesn't argue #5.  #3 - Special Prosecutor makes her argument.  Court will not grant at this time.  Attorney Matousek makes his argument.  Will partially grant request and will limit evidence to firearms in livingroom and kitchen.  #4 - Attorney Matousek gives his argument.  Defense given leave to supply the Court with more information in writing.  #3 - SP Jay will give more written argument to the Court.  Due date of arguments to the Court is 3-2-18.
State's Second Motions in Limine
State's Notice of Motion for Leave to Amend the Information

Special Prosecutor Annie Jay appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person.  Attorney Matousek and Judge Goodman appeared by telephone.  State is waiting for a transcript of the jury trial and cannot be ready for a trial in October.  Reschedule final pretrial and jury trial.  4 day jury trial.  FPT set for 2/14/18 at 1:30 pm.  2 hours.  4 day jury trial starting 3/2618.  Motions to be filed and served so that they can be heard at the final pre-trial.
Preliminary Hearing of 2-18-16
to Judge Goodman from Attorney Jay.  emailed to Judge Goodman's J.A.  JMM
by defendant
by surety
Bond sent to grandfather for signature.  Note from T.N.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: victim's family.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Matousek.  Motion to modify bond.  Attorney Matousek argued for lower cash or signature bond.  DA Fox argued to continue cash bond.  $20,000.00 cash.  Court ordered $10,000. cash bond.   Same conditions.
Motion to Modify Bond
Testimony of R.V. at jury trial on 1/24/17
Of A. O. at the jury trial on 1/23/17
JT & FPT
I put all the paper exhibits from the trial in an envelope and put it in the Exhibit Closet.  They are all scanned into the case also.
14 Names of Jurors selected to serve

1 - Diagram of home (stored in Evidence Closet)
2 - CD with scene photos (stored in Evidence Closet)
3 - CD with 911 calls (stored in Evidence Closet)
4 to 12 - Photos
13 - Report of Trooper
14 to 17 - Photos
18 - A.O.'s Report
19 - Photo
20 - Autopsy Report
21 - Empty Casing (stored in Evidence Closet)
22 - Fragments Removed at Autopsy (stored in Evidence Closet)
23 & 24 - Photos
25 - Military Records
26 - Withdrawn
27 - AR-15 Rifle (stored at JASO)
28 to 30 - Photos
31 - Magazine from AR-15 (stored in Evidence Closet)
32 - Firearm Crime Lab Report
33 - Test Fired Cartridge & Casing (stored in Evidence Closet)
34 - Blood Draw Form
35 - Blood Test Kit (stored in Evidence Closet)
36 - Blood Test Report
37 to 39 - Photos
40 - Cartridge casing (stored in Evidence Closet)
41 - Evidence Inventory
42 - S.B's Report
Exhibits 1 - 42
7 Jury Questions and 1 typed response by Judge to jurors

Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel John Matousek.  On the record at 9:00 a.m. for jury instruction conference.  Jury is not present.  Exhibit 42 is received as evidence.  Discussed verdict options.  Defendant states he will not request additional instruction on Homicide by Use of Dangerous Weapon.  Colloquy performed with defendant and his counsel regarding such.  Defendant knowingly and voluntarily has made his decision.  DA Fox requests to be allowed to demonstrate to the jurors how much weight it takes to pull a trigger.  Attorney Matousek objects and gives his argument.  Court will not allow.  Break until jury in at 10:00 a.m.  

Back on record at 10:07 with jury still out.  Jury in at 10:11 a.m.  Closing jury instructions begin.  Closing argument by DA Fox begins at 10:52.  Attorney Matousek begins his closing argument at 10:50.  Rebuttal argument by DA Fox.  Closing arguments end at 12:13.  Judge continues with closing instructions.  Jury bailiffs are sworn.  Alternate announced by the Judge.  Jury out to deliberate at 12:20 p.m.  On record at 1:48 p.m. - Gerald Fox is present for the State.  Attorney John Matousek is present, as well as his client.  Jury has a question: " Is utter disregard involved with 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide?"  After arugments of counsel, Judge writes an answer referencing the instructions and the note will go back.  Back on record at 2:58.   Jury question - "If we are allowed to know, what happens if we don't come to an agreement?"  Argument by both counsel.  Another note from jury:  They want additional copies of the jury instructions.  Judge instructs bailiff to ask them how many they want and they will get them.  Further argument by counsel.  Judge will leave it at giving them the additional jury instructions they requested for now and referred them to Instructions 460 and 515.  Back on record at 3:50 p.m. with all parties present.  Jury question:  "We are unable to reach unanimous decision, would like further instructions."  Jury back in at 3:52 and given additional jury instruction and sent back in to deliberate further.  Back on record at 4:11 and all parties are present.  Jury question:  "Several jurors need a more specific definition of unreasonable, substantial and aware.  A juror has requested layman's terms."  Judge reads from a description on the internet for aware and Black's Law Dictionary for other words requested.  Argument by both counsel.  Jury in at 4:18 and Judge gives jurors definitions of the words requested.  Judge states he will send them the definitions in writing.  Back on record at 4:  with all parties present.  Jury question:  "I, T.S., have an appointment today at 5:30.  Can someone else please contact......."  Clerk called the phone number and left a message.  

Back on record at 5:42 and all parties are present with jury out.  Jury question:  "Jury cannot come to a unanimous decision........"    DA Fox makes his statement to the Court and asks the Court to declare a mistrial.  Attorney Matousek agrees.  Jury in at 5:45.  Court polls the jurors if they agree they are deadlocked.  They all answer yes.  Court declares a mistrial.  Jurors are excused from the courtroom.  DA Fox asks to put this on the calendar tomorrow to schedule a new FPT and jury trial date and that bond continue.  Attorney Matousek would like to discuss with his client and to schedule FPT and trial by phone by Monday or Tuesday.  Judge will have his J.A. email counsel for scheduling.
Jury Trial Testimony of R. V. on January 25, 2017

Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel John Matousek.  On record at 9:37 with jury out.  Exhibit 21 is offered/received.  Jury brought in at 9:41. 

State calls K.G., sworn, testifies.  Exhibit 34 marked - Blood Draw Report, witness testifies to exhibit.  Witness ID's defendant/record reflects ID.  Attorney Matousek cross-examines witness.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Witness is released from subpoena.

State calls S.B., sworn, testifies.  Exhibit 35 marked - Blood Test Kit, witness testifies to this exhibit.  Exhibit 35 offered/received.  No questions by defense.  Witness to remain and under subpoena.

State calls A.G., sworn, testifies.  Witness testifies to Exhibit 34.  Exhibit 34 offered/received.  Exhibit 35 offered/received.  Exhibit 36 marked - Blood Test Report, offered/received.  Attorney Matousek cross-examines witness.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Re-cross by attorney Matousek.  Witness is released from her subpoena.

State calls R.N.S., sworn, testifies.  Exhibits 37, 38, 39 marked.  Witness testifies to exhibits.  Exhibit 40 marked, witness testifies to exhibit.  Exhibits 37-40 offered/received.  Attorney Matousek cross-examines the witness.  Witness is released from subpoena.

State calls C.K., sworn, testifies.  Witness testifies to Exhibit 27 - AR-15.  Defense counsel cross-examines witness.  Witness is released from subpoena.

State calls A.S., sworn, testifies.  Witness testifies to Exhibit 40 and Exhibit 27.  Cross examination by Attorney Matousek.  Witness testifies to Exhibit 31 - Magazine.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Re-cross by attorney Matousek.  Witness is released from subpoena.  State rests.  Break for lunch at 11:58 a.m.  Jury out.  Attorney Matousek makes motion to dismiss 1st Degree Homicide charge and gives his argument; regarding 2nd Degree Homicide charge doesn't believe the State can proceed on that charge.  DA Fox makes argument against motion.  Attorney Matousek gives rebuttal argument.  Court denies motion and it will go to the jury.

Back on record at 1:15 p.m. with jury out.  Attorney Matousek states his client wishes to testify.  Judge performs colloquy with defendant of his right to testify or not testify.  He states he wants to testify.  Court finds the defendant understands his rights to testify or not testify, no threats or promises made, has discussed with his attorney, understands the advantages/disadvantages.  Finds he knowinly, voluntarily makes his decision to testify and accepts his decision.  Jury back in at 1:19 p.m.

Attorney Matousek re-calls S.B., to testify.  Exhibit 41 marked - Evidence Inventory.  Witness testifies to what is in the exhibit.  State stipulates that the marijuana pipe the witness is being questioned about came from the livingroom table.  Exhibit 42 marked - S.B.'s report.  Exhibit used to refresh memory.  Witness reviews Exhibit 7 - photo (not previously presented but was marked).  Exhibit 7 - offered/received and published to the jury.  Exhibit 41 offered/received.  Cross by DA Fox.  Re-direct by attorney Matousek.  Witness is released from his subpoena.

Defense calls the defendant, M.N..  He is sworn and testifies.  DA Fox cross-examines the defendant.  Re-direct examination by attorney Matousek.  Re-cross by DA Fox.  No further questions.  Defendant steps down.  Defense has not more witnesses.  Judge orders evidence is closed.  There is a stipulation that drugs were not involved with defendant or members of his entourage.

No motions to be heard outside of the jury by either counsel.  Jury instructed to come back at 10:00 tomorrow.  Jury admonished to not discuss this case with anyone and they are excused.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Dr. M.S. to appear at JT.

Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel John Matousek.  On record with jury out at 8:31 a.m.  Jury brought in at 8:36.  State calls first witness, A.R., sworn, testifies.  Attorney Matousek stipulates that the Steven Nelson 911 call can be played without having it authenticated by Steven Nelson.  DA plays audio clips of 911 calls which is marked as Exhibit 3.  Exhibit 3 offered/received.  Witness continues with testimony.  Cross-examination by attorney Matousek.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Re-cross by Matousek.  Witness is released from her subpoena.  
State calls C.T., sworn, testifies.  Trooper assigned to I-94 on that evening.  Went to location. Witness ID's defendant, record reflects ID.  DA refers to 079 & 078 images on Exhibit 2 - photo of rifle.  Witness testifies to images.  Cross-examination of witness by defense.  Defense marks exhibits 4 - 12 with clerk.  Shows witness Exhibit 4 - photo, witness  to photo and states he does not recall rifles leaning against the wall.  At the time had tunnel vision and was only focused on a few things - defendant's hands and the victim.  Exhibit 11 - wider view, testifies to exhibit. Defendant wanted to stay by Reggie and allowed him to do so. Exhibit 13  - Witness's report used to refresh memory.  Exhibits 4 & 11 offered/received and published to jury.   Judge orders Exhibit 13 be part of the record but has not been received into evidence. Exhibit 4 shown to witness, testifies.  Exhibit 14 - Photo of 074 image - witness testifies to photo.  Exhibit 14 offered/received.  Re-cross by defense.  Witness is released from subpoena.  

State calls A.O., sworn, testifies. Responded to shooting incident in Jackson County.  DA shows witness photos from Exhibit 2.  Testifies to photos and identifying information per Crime Lab - Images 063, 065, 067, 070, 0071, 072, 073, 074, 0076, 079, 082 080, 0090, 108, 116, 136, 137, 136(?), 140, 143, 146, 148, 166, 201, 202, 203, 205.  Witness testifies to Exhibit 1 - published to the jury.  Exhibit 2 offered/received.   Defense marks Exhibits 16 - 17 and cross examines witness.  Exhibit 8 shown to witness and he testifies to photo.  Exhibit 8 offered/received and is published to jury.  Exhibit 9 - testifies to photo, offered/received and is published to jury.  Exhibit 10 - photo, offered/received and published.  Exhibits 12, 5, 6, 17, 16, 15 are all received and may be published to jury.  Witness testifies to photos previously received and then publishes to jury. Exhibit 18 marked - used to refresh memory.   Exhibit 18 is made part of record but not received into evidence.   Re-direct by DA Fox.  Witness testifies to Exhibit 1.   Re-cross by Matousek.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Exhibit 19 marked - photo of victim on couch.  Exhibit 19 offered/released.  Witness released from subpoena.  

State calls M.S., sworn, testifies.  Performs forensic autopsy exams.  Performed autopsy on victim.  Exhibit 20 marked - Autopsy/Toxicology Report.  Witness uses report to refresh his memory.  Cause of death was determined as chest trauma from discharge of firearm. Exhibit 21 marked - Empty casing , powder, in plastic envelope.  Witness testifies to exhibit.  Exhibit 21 published to jury.  Exhibit 20 - offered/received.  Exhibit 22 will not yet be offered until further testimony by another witness.  Attorney Matousek cross-examines witness.  Witness refers to page 4 of his report - Exhibit 20.    Exhibits 23 & 24 marked by clerk.  Witness is shown Exhibit 1 and 23.  Exhibit 24 - witness testifies to these exhibits.  Exhibits 23 & 24 offered/received.  Defense questions witness.  Testifies regarding marijuana use of victim.  Witness is excused from subpoena.  Will break for lunch.  Jurors are admonished to not discuss the case.

Back on record at 12:58 with jury out.  Attorney Matousek refers to a Motion to Impeach that he filed regarding testimony for R.V. He reviewed the Motion given to him by DA Fox.  Judge states he must answer 2 to prior convictions when asked.  Jury back in at 1:02.  State called L.O., sworn, testifies.  Chief Deputy Coroner for Jackson County.  Dispatched to scene.  Deceased was Randal H. Perry and residence is in Jackson County.  Reviewed autopsy report and issued death certificate - penetrating gun shot wound to the chest/homicide.  No questions by defense.  Witness is released from her subpoena.  

State calls E.I, sworn, testifies. Witness ID's defendant, record reflects ID.   Exhibit 25 marked - Defendant's Military Records.  Witness testifies to exhibit. Exhibit 25 offered/received.   Defense cross-examines witness.  DA Fox performs more re-cross.  Jury out.  Attorney Matousek has never seen a military document that DA Fox was going to present as an exhibit (Military document - DD214).  Attorney Matousek objects to the document on the grounds of discovery.  Gerald Fox makes his argument and states the document was on the disk with the discovery documents given to the defense.  Military form DD214 marked as Exhibit 26.  DA Fox states on the disk marked "Case Files" the document is on that disk entitled Certificate of Discharge.  Attorney Matousek gives argument that he never received it.  DA Fox withdraws Exhibit 26.  Jury brought back in.  Witness is released from his subpoena.

State calls K.G., sworn, testifies.  Witness ID's defendant/record reflects ID.  Continues testimony.  Took him to Black River Memorial Hospital for a legal blood draw.  Exhibit 27 marked - AR-15 Rifle.  Exhibit 28 marked- photo.  Exhibit 29 marked - photo image 143.  Exhibits 27, 28, 29 are offered/received.  Exhibit 30 marked - Live Rounds of Ammunition.  Exhibit 31 marked - Magazine for AR-15.  Exhibits 30 & 31 offered/received.  Witness testifies to Exhibit 21.  Moves that Exhibit 31 and Exhibit 27 remain in deputy's custody until finished with testimony.  Exhibit 30 is offered and received.  Attorney Matousek cross-examines witness.  Did not note any slurred speech.  Trained in NITSA and indicia of impairment.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Witness to remain in courtroom in possession of Exhibits 27 & 31.

State calls M.S., sworn, testifies. Exhibit 32 marked - Firearm Crime Lab Report.   Exhibit 27 - AR-15 is confirmed by witness that it is the same rifle he examined.  Exhibit 33 marked - Test Cartridge Casing - witness verifies it's the one he fired for testing.  Exhibit 33 offered/received.  Testifies to comparison of M-16 and AR-15.  Exhibit 22 shown to witness and testifies to exhibit.   Offers Exhibit 32/received.  Attorney Matousek cross-examines witness.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Witness is released from his subpoena.

State calls R.V., sworn, testifies.   Witness shown Exhibit 27 - confirms it's Reggie's AR-15 and one of the guns he moved.  It probably was loaded when he moved it judging by the weight of it.  Re-cross by Attorney Matousek.  Convicted of how many crimes?  Once I believe.  In fact 2 correct?  Same occasion but 2 different crimes?  Sure, yes.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Shows witness Exhibit 29 and he testifies to questions regarding the safety on the gun.  It was on safety when he moved it.  Attorney Matousek questions witness.  Gave police accurate and truthful information.  Released from subpoena.

State calls M.K., sworn, testifies.  He transported the body and attended the autopsy of the victim.  Took custody of physical evidence as a result of autopsy.  Shows witness Exhibit 22 - tesifies what the exhibit is and where it came from.  Exhibit 22 offered/received.  Witness is shown Exhibit 27 - AR-15, which appears to be the rifle from the scene.  Witness brought a magazine and plastic ammunition for demonstration purposes.  He loads the ammo into the magazine and then loads it into the AR-15 (Exhibit 27).  Demonstrates how to load, fire, and clear weapon.  Attorney Matousek cross-examines the witness.  He has heard of some accidental discharges with law enforcement officers.  Witness is released from subpoena.  Jury out and to return by 9:30.  DA Fox asks permission to have Exhibit 27 kept in the evidence locker.  No objection by defense.  Approved.  Discussion on plan for testimony for tomorrow.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on J.O. to appear at jury trial

Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel John Matousek.  Motions heard in chambers.  In courtroom, voir dire process begins at 9:04 a.m.  All jurors given oath.  Gerald Fox begins his voir dire at 10:16.  Defense counsel John Matousek starts his voir dire at 10:46 and completed at 11:46.  Panel selected at 12:00 and given oath.  Break for lunch.  Back on record with jury present at 1:15 p.m.  Panel sworn again.  Judge begins preliminary jury instructions.  DA Fox begins opening statement at 1:33 p.m.  Attorney Matousek begins his opening statement at 1:51 p.m.  Opening statements end at 2:19 p.m.  Take short break.  Back on record with jury present at 2:31 p.m.  State calls first witness, A.O., sworn and testifies as to events of November 15, 2015.  Defendant is her boyfriend's brother.  Witness ID's defendant, record reflects ID.  Exhibit 1 - Diagram of victim's home shown to witness.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.  Exhibit 2 - CD with 38 photos - Witness testifies to photos in exhibit.  Her parents, defendant, her boyfriend & herself, and their children were at the house.  Brought beer to victim's home with them.  Her parents left at one point leaving her, Steven, defendant and victim.  Did not know at the time someone was asleep in one of the bedrooms.  Happy atmosphere when everyone arrived at Reggie's house.  Victim did not smoke marijuana while they were there.  Michael was looking at the automatic rifle and he had ejected a round and describes how he did that.  Doesn't recall him handling the magazine at this time.  Her fianace told her he had unloaded the guns in the house.  Reggie was intoxicated when they got there.  Didn't know of any medical issues he had.  Reggie wished Michael a happy veteran's day when he got there.  Steven was circulating around in the house.  Don't recall seeing Michael pick up a round or anything off the floor.  Witness states she asked about victim's daughter and he got pretty emotional.  I didn't want the kids to see him emotional so decided it was time to go.  Steven went out to warm up vehicle and she got the kids ready to go.  When at the door trying to get the kids outside, just barely outside and heard a gunshot.  Told daughter to go to dad and went back into the house.  DA shows witness Exhibit 1 - Diagram of layout of house and she testifies to location of subjects.  Michael was standing near coffee table and Reggie was on couch laying back on couch; gasping for air.  Michael was standing there with his hands behind his back.  Didn't see a weapon.  Initially thought there was a shot into the floor.  Michael said he shot him but told me to call 911.  Could tell he was in shock.  Didn't hear any harsh words between the two that evening but could hear them speaking - Michael, Reggie, and Steve.  Trying to get kids out the door wasn't aware of what Michael was doing.  She went down first flight of stairs and screamed for Steven.  At first, he didn't believe me.  I was crying and in shock.  Interviewed that morning by law enforcement.  Michael was graduated and was looking for employment.  Recently served in Iraq.  Feels Michael was intoxicated at the time.  She was trained in hunter safety.  Never shot anyone..... Objection by defense.  Sustained.  Could see blood on Reggie's chest.  Didn't see any blood on Michael. Busy looking after kids so don't recall everything going on.  Michael had locked the door and couldn't get back in.  Cross-examination by attorney Matousek.  He was like a dad to her.  His daughter got into drugs and caused anxiety and sadness for Reggie.  Close relationship with Reggie and her parents as well.  Known Michael for about 10 years - he's fun, patient, caring.  Steven asked Michael to help with insulating porch.  He arrived and she went out hunting.  They went out to help find deer she though she hit.  They all came back to house and before making dinner went to her parents.  Invited them for supper.  She, children, and mother went to Warren's Mall and bought some wine.  Went back home, made dinner, and they all ate.  Got frustrated with Steve not helping with kids and took out on Steve and Michael.  Michael is never the hot head.  They started drinking after supper around 6 p.m.  Had gone through a 24-pack of beer and went to get more at the Warren's Mall.  Reggie and R.B. pulled up and they were pretty intoxicated.  Later Reggie said they'd been on a 2-day bender.  Reggie told them to stop down.  Got home with beer after 9:00.  Got home Steve said he didn't want to leave as they were still trying to smoke some meat.  Got kids into pajamas, got ready to go and eventually went to Reggie's.  She wanted to go to Reggie's.  Went in 3 different vehicles.  Pulled up and could hear very loud music.  Not unsual.  Reggie let us in and he was happy.  She describes the condition of the home and what she was concerned about with the kids there.  Michael would go outside as he smokes when he drinks.  Steven also went outside some.  Reggie got on floor and played with kids.  Her parents weren't there very long.  Wasn't unusual for Reggie to have guns around the house and had quite an arsenal - loves guns.  The AR was his pride and joy.  Getting ready to leave.  Michael said to give him a minute.  Can't determine length of time between going down the stairs and hearing the gunshot.  A gun had been shot into the floor at some previous time per Reggie.  She thought that's what happened.  Michael calmly told her to call 911, but his eyes were frantic.  He locked the door so they couldn't get back into the house.  Michael had already put a coat on Reggie's chest to probably put pressure on wound.  Re-direct by DA Fox:  Jacket was a green fleece, army fleece Michael wore that night.  He's not rendering any aid when she saw him.  Michael knew Reggie for about 5 years.  Didn't go there regularly like they did.  Knew him as Steven's brother.  Re-cross by Matousek:  Did not see him render aid.  She will remain under her subpoena.  May leave courthouse today.  State calls next witness, S.N., sworn, testifies.  Defendant is his brother, ID's defendant.  Saw Michael handle the AR - pull action open, bullet fell out on floor, pulled out clip, released action.  He told Reggie, you know it's loaded and Reggie just gave him a look.  Seemed like he was going to put it back the way it was but I told him to leave it unloaded.  Set it on the ground with clip next to it on the floor.  Witness testifies to photos in Exhibit 2.  Fiance came out screaming, told her to get in car.  Ran to house and door was locked.  Michael came to door and told him to call 911 and that Reggie was shot.  They all left and went to her parents and he made the 911 call.  During the call found out his brother had also called.  Michael served in military for 8 years and was starting his 2nd term. Also recently graduated from police academy.  Had seen him handle guns maybe twice.  He'd been to Reggie's 5 - 8 times over 10 year period.  Believed Michael was intoxicated, shouldn't have handled firearms, or drive himself home.  Cross examination by attorney Matousek:  Begged him to come down to help him with remodel project.  He is very close with his brother.  A lot of military background in their family.  Knew Reggie for 10 - 11 years and were very close.  He was a great person.  Would help anybody.  He was a gun enthusiast.  He would shoot every weekend and have people over for cookouts.  Michael was going to school and was working at Menards Distribution Center part-time.  He lived in Eau Claire with their grandfather, 86 years old.  Michael got there about 3:30 - 4:00.  Worked on project, went to look for deer.  Describes when he had an accidental discharge of a gun when hunting.  Went to Reggie's about 12:00, 12:15 a.m.  Loud music playing.  Everyone goes into house.  People were milling around, getting beer, going out to smoke.  Busy watching kids.  Knew Reggie was intoxicated.  When Michael is intoxicated he opens up more, he's a quiet guy otherwise, doesn't act out.  Heard gunshot when he was in car with engine running.  Sounded like a loud thump.  Fiance came out screaming and said Reggie was shot.  I went to door but couldn't get back in.  He told me to call 911.  Told him to let him in as he's certified in first aid and CPR.  Called 911 before we were out of the driveway.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Never owned AR.  Witness is excused and is released from subpoena.  Will start at 8:30 tomorrow morning due to predicted weather in afternoon.  Judge admonishes jurors to not discuss the case. Jury out.  Discussion of plan for tomorrow as far as witness testimony.  DA Fox will hold onto Exhibit 2 until testimony by another witness tomorrow.  He will refer to image numbers during testimony.  Back on record with jury out.  A juror told a bailiff they are worried they will loose a temp job by serving 5 days.  Juror brought into courtroom to explain the situation.  Counsel has no questions of juror but DA Fox is concerned to proceed without 2 alternates.  Attorney Matousek and his client are OK to proceed with 13 jurors.  After discussion, DA Fox does not object to continuing with 13 jurors.  Judge Goodman orders she be discharged from jury duty.

Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel John Matousek.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Court addresses  State's Motion in Limine  - (I missed #1) Court grants #2 , #3  - ?, #4, 5 & 6 counsel to submit a brief before end of 2016, #7 - granted, #8 - granted; a 2nd officer to assist Gerald is approved as they won't be a witness, #9 - granted, #10 - granted, #11 - granted, #12 - granted.  Expert testimony (4) - no objections.  Motion to Impeach J.L.P. (2) - granted.  Judge states he will address jury instructions today.  State's MIL #1 - no objection, #2 - no objection, #3 - already provided, #4 - all evidence given to the State, #5 - won't raise any violent behavior on victim or self defense issues, #6 - 9 - no intention to ? of State's witnesses, #10 - granted, #11 - granted.  Defendant's Motion in Limine (didn't refer to number in Motion) regarding photos 21 & 25 - stip to exclusion.  Defendant's motion regarding admission of witness's, R.V., prior conviction - DA stipulates - granted.  Judge will review defense's jury instructions later.  DA Fox wants a minimum of 80 jurors summoned and to use both courtrooms with video and audio.  Court orders clerk to summons 100 jurors.  DA Fox requests 1 or 2 witnesses be able to handle the rifle used during testimony to demonstrate how it's used.  Attorney Matousek argues against it.  Judge will decide later if it needs to be done more than once.

Defendant appears in person in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel John Matousek.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Information was filed in February per DA Fox.  Judge reveiws charge in Information.  Defense enters NGP.  Requests PTC, STC, and jury trial date late in January.  Court sets JT date starting January 23 for 5 days. records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael O Nelson in court with attorney John M. Matousek.  Defendant Michael O Nelson in custody.  Gerald Roger Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls witness, K.B., sworn, testifies.  Describes the dispatch calls that came in to both Monroe County and Jackson County and who responded.  Stated names of people who were present at residence and what information was given by them regarding the events of the night/incident.  Record reflects ID of defendant by witness.  Testimony regarding defendant would have received training in the military regarding weapons and how to operate.  Blood sample tubes broke on way to crime lab but were still able to be tested - defendant's BAC was .07.  Balistic tests are not back yet but weapon seems consistent with the report of the incident and evidence recovered.  Rifle is at crime lab.  Defense cross-examines witness.  There were a lot of guns in the residence - witness estimates more than 20.  His blood was drawn around 6 am - several hours had passed between shooting and blood collection.  Describes how blood tubes (2) were packaged/mailed.  State re-directs testimony of witness.  Re-cross by defense.  State moves for bind over and requests time to consider wethere to seek a charge of 1st degree reckless homicide.  Information to be filed later.  Defense has no witnesses but asks Court to decline charge as stated by the State and states his basis.  State replies.  Court states her only function at this hearing is to determine if probable cause exists.  Defendant is bound over for trial.  Defense filed Request for Substitution of Judge.  Arraignment will be set by new Judge.  Defendant remanded to JASO.

records.addlTxt: Defendant is appearing by VTC from Jackson County Jail with counsel John Matousek present in the courtroom.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.

Defendant is appearing by VTC from Jackson County Jail with counsel John Matousek present in the courtroom.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defense waives the reading of the complaint; waives time limits for preliminary hearing and requests a PTC.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing within the time limits with the defendant.  Court finds the defendant knowingly and intelligently waives the time limits.  Court sets for PTC 12-9 at 10:00 and status 1-4-16 at 3:00.  Bond cont.
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-23-2015 09:30 am

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: victim's family.

Defendant Michael O Nelson in court via videoteleconference from Jackson County Jail.  Melissa S. Inlow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant admitted service of complaint. Court advised right to preliminary hearing. Defendant wishes to have attorney representation. Defendant to contact State Public Defender's office right away and appear with counsel at next scheduled hearing. Court orders $100,000 cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
